page.title: 01BOXWORTH - GAZETTEER
page.content: {Boxworth is a small village of 171 {persons,situated 12 kilometres North {West of Cambridge. It consists of 65 {houses, a Church,and public house on {the road between Swavesey and {Elsworth.The population has not grown {appreciably in the last thirty years. {The elevation of the land is only 40 {metres in an area of low,boulder clay {hills on Kimmeridge clay. The village {is situated in a shallow valley. The {land is open given over to arable {crops. Small woodlands exist close to {the village.Employment within the {village is basically agricultural, {Boxworth has no shopping facilities or {services such as post office, garage {or school. most workers commute to {Cambridge, schoolchildren go to {Elsworth Primary or Swavesey Village {College. { }
